title.narrative: 2. DEMAND FOR Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SERVICES

description.narrative: By 2020, rural communities are better equipped to increase demand for water and adopt recommended hygiene and sanitation practices., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Sanitation, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children living in rural areas have improved access to quality water, a healthy environment and sustainable sanitation facilities in communities, in schools, and at health centres.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, rural communities are better equipped to increase demand for water and adopt recommended hygiene and sanitation practices.

description.narrative: The BCO made a significant contribution at reducing the open defecation at the national level in the first semester of 2020. A total 259 new communities that were triggered in 2019 obtained their open defecation free (ODF) certification status, hence benefitting 280,277 people in these areas. The BCO also reached 20,075 girls through menstrual hygiene management (MHM) activities in 402 schools. Furthermore, 500 girls in internally displaced people (IDP) sites were supported through MHM kit distribution to manage their menstruation with dignity and privacy in a rather difficult humanitarian context. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020
